BR_text.BRsummary: WriteProtoToTextFile writes nothing when the target file does not exist
BR_text.BRdescription:
I found that  does not write anything if  does not indicate an existing file, due to use of open(2) with  at <denchmark-link:https://github.com/BVLC/caffe/blob/master/src/caffe/util/io.cpp#L46>https://github.com/BVLC/caffe/blob/master/src/caffe/util/io.cpp#L46</denchmark-link>
 . I think this behavior is unintuitive (and also inconsistent with its binary version). Is it intended? If not, I want to fix it.

comments_0.comment_text:
Fixed in dev by <denchmark-link:https://github.com/BVLC/caffe/pull/417>#417</denchmark-link>
 . Thanks for pointing this out.
